newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil ends higher on covering, soyoil.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil ends higher on covering, soyoil.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICALS

PALM OIL FUTURES - Prices ended higher on covering and technical support aided by soyoil gains in Chicago. Price movements were limited due to uncertainty over fundamentals and currency factors. Oct futures range is 1,150-1,180. Next week trend depends on fresh estimates from forecaster Ivan Wong.
PALM OIL PHYSICALS - The market was also firmer with some refiners covering. Interest was seen among crude palm oil.
Trading was mainly on technical factor with third month October futures closing at 1,167 ringgit ($443.89) a tonne. The support level for October is 1,150 ringgit with resistance at 1,180.
Talk of lower stocks for end-July also aided the market. There was talk that end-July stock was at 810,000-820,000 against Ivan Wong's estimate of 865,000-875,000 tonnes.
Volume on the futures market totalled 1,563 lots.
Physicals August was offered at 1,207.50 ringgit a tonne against bids of 1,202.50. It was traded at 1,200 and 1,202.50.
Aug (central) saw offers at 1,195 against bids of 1,190 with trades done at 1,185 and 1,190.
Sept (south) saw offers at 1,207.50 ringgit against bids of 1,202.50 with trades done at 1,185 and 1,190.
In refined palm oil, Aug RBD palm oil was offered at $482.50 a tonne FOB Malaysia, Sept at $482.50 and Oct/Nov/Dec at $480. Oct/Nov/Dec was traded at $477.50.
August RBD palm olein saw offers at $522.50, Sept at $517.50 and Oct/Nov/Dec at $517.50. Oct/Nov/Dec saw sellers at $515.
Aug RBD palm stearin was offered $365 a tonne, and Aug/Sept RBD palm fatty acid distillate saw offers at $290.
